blocks.text: 1. Assuming the results for \( d(\cosh x) = \sinh x \) and \( d(\sinh x) = \cosh x \), the derivative of \( \log \tan x \ \) is given by the equation.

blocks.description: Derivative of the logarithm of the tangent function expressed in terms of sine and cosine.

blocks.text: 2. Given that \( U = 13x^2 \) (pulling on a balloon), find the velocity when \( v = \frac{dU}{dt} \) and express it in terms of \( x \).
3. If \( v = \frac{U}{x} \) and \( x = 1 + \frac{1}{x} \), find the acceleration \( a = \frac{dv}{dt} \).

blocks.description: Acceleration in terms of the derivative of velocity.

blocks.text: 4. If \( v \) is velocity, find \( \ldots \) and also the angular velocity of a connecting rod.
5. Find \( M \) when \( M = w(\ell - 2) \), with \( M \) being a function of the length of a beam. Then, \( r = \frac{w}{C} \) and find the quotient \( \frac{dM}{dt} \) when it is noted.

blocks.description: Relationship between P, C, and r.
